Author: cousin_it
Content: I consciously try to program like a newbie, moving ahead clumsily and directly. Make it work, then make it small. Code is a bridge, it doesn't need to look good, just get me across. What use is a beautiful bridge to nowhere?

Author: jsmcgd
Content:
The following article is my functional programming bible. I always refer to it when things start to get a little hazy.

http://www.defmacro.org/ramblings/fp.html

If you read it (the continuations section) you will understand continuations. I stake my HN reputation on it (whatever that's worth).

Author: bdfh42
Content: Looks like a good post but somewhat spoiled by the site's advertisements and surveys blocking progress through it's multiple pages.

Author: jdvolz
Content: I'm in favor of the speed of flat files.  I have two Windows desktop applications (one for sale, one freeware) that both were converted from using a database to using a simple flat file.  It was easier to program and much easier to distribute.  One of the programs has a search functionality - it's just the normal linear text search.  Even with all the data I have in the program it's instantaneous.
